snippet: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether the House can sue the executive branch for usurping its authority over spending.
abstract: House Republicans, long seeking way to challenge Obama administration for flouting congressional authority, settle on healthcare law to challenge executive power; federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether House can sue executive branch for usurping its authority over spending in relation to Affordable Care Act; suit would mark first in which the House has won right to sue executive branch over appropriations power.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether the House can sue the executive branch for usurping its authority over spending.

headline.main: House Republicans, Seizing on Health Law, Challenge Executive Branch
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Seize on Health Law to Challenge Executive Power

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
